c74object.name: iralign~
c74object.description: iralign~ performs simple time alignment of IRs by aligning samples

inlet.description: The align & alignto messages perform IR alignment and must be followed by their required arguments

method.name: align
method.description:
Syntax: align <symbol: buffer_name> [<symbol: buffer_name>] [<symbol: buffer_name>]
Align in place: input buffer~ 1 2 3 etc ...... [variable number of args]

method.name: alignto
method.description:
Syntax: alignto <symbol: buffer_name> <symbol: buffer_name> [<symbol: buffer_name>] [<symbol: buffer_name>]
Align out of place: output buffer~ 1 2 3 etc ...... / input buffer~ 1 2 3 etc ...... [variable number of args]
Inputs are aligned in corresponding output buffers

attribute.name: readchan
attribute.description:
Sets the channel number for buffer~ reading (1-4). If the specified channel does not exist the value is wrapped within the existing number of channels (so 3 will read from channel 1 of a two-channel buffer~, 4 from channel 2).
units: int, default: 1, range: 1..4

attribute.name: resize
attribute.description:
If on, the buffer~ will resize to the necessary size before write. Resizing erases all contents of the buffer~.
Otherwise, output will ONLY happen if there is enough room to write the entire output, leaving the latter contents of the buffer~ and other buffer~ channels unaffected.
units: flag, default: 1, range: 0/1

attribute.name: writechan
attribute.description:
Sets the channel number for buffer~ writing (1-4). If the specified channel does not exist the value is wrapped within the existing number of channels (so 3 will write to channel 1 of a two-channel buffer~, 4 to channel 2).
units: int, default: 1, range: 1..4

c74object.discussion: iralign~ performs simple time alignment of IRs by aligning the samples with the maximum absolute value. This may either be done in-place or out-of-place.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (messages)
entry.description: The align or alignto messages. The align & alignto messages perform IR alignment and must be followed by their required arguments

entry.name: More details
entry.description: iralign~ performs simple time alignment of IRs by aligning the samples with the maximum absolute value. This may either be done in-place or out-of-place.
